gmmaker > gameLobby

gameLobby 

interface gameLobby

Information about the current lobby (players, settings, etc).

Summary

Properties from gameLobby

number[]
allPlayerIds

Array that contains all player IDs in use.
number
clientId

The player ID corresponding to you, the one running the code.
number
hostId

The player ID corresponding to the room host.
lobbyPlayerInfo[]
playerInfo

Array that contains lobby-specific attributes for every player currently alive, such as usernames, levels and skin colours.
gameSettings
settings

Game settings set by the host of the game, such as the non-GMM mode and the amount of rounds needed to win.

Public Properties

allPlayerIds gmm.d.ts:1016 
allPlayerIds: number[]

number[]

Array that contains all player IDs in use.

This list is static, so if a player leaves or another one joins, this will not change until next game.

clientId gmm.d.ts:1002 
clientId: number

number

The player ID corresponding to you, the one running the code.

VERY IMPORTANT, PLEASE READ: Because it's your ID, the value of clientId is going to be different for every single person in the room, because for them, it's their ID. This means you can potentially desync the game if you use it incorrectly.

In order to not desync the game, you should only use it for graphical or audio purposes (like, for example, to create a drawing only if your ID is 2, which will make the drawing only visible to a player with the ID 2), and it must not modify the game state at all.

hostId gmm.d.ts:1012 
hostId: number

number

The player ID corresponding to the room host.

playerInfo gmm.d.ts:1022 
playerInfo: lobbyPlayerInfo[]

lobbyPlayerInfo[]

Array that contains lobby-specific attributes for every player currently alive, such as usernames, levels and skin colours.

Ordered by player ID (discs[0] is player with ID 0, discs[2] is player with ID 2, etc.)

settings gmm.d.ts:1028 
settings: gameSettings

gameSettings

Game settings set by the host of the game, such as the non-GMM mode and the amount of rounds needed to win.
